page.title: 15SALISBURY'S COMMUNITY POLICE
page.content: A local community police officer says that school children in Salisbury are generally well-behaved and few complaints are made to the police. The main job of the police is for the protection of life and property and prosecution of people for comitting offences. The days have gone when children run away from policeman.The community policing is really to build up a relationship with the people in the area.Children should speak to the local policeman, saying "hello" or "goodbye". More friendly contact with the police is likely to mean fewer crimes. The average crime rate for children in this area is 3%; smoking and shoplifting are the main offences. Police depend on teachers and parents to help in their work. Community policing is considered very important.
